intro: Ricinocarpos graniticus, commonly known as the granite rock dandelion, is a flowering plant native to rocky, arid environments. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellow composite flowers and hairy, lobed leaves. The plant is adapted to grow in nutrient-poor soils and is often found on granite outcrops. Its seeds are dispersed by wind, and it plays a role in stabilizing soil in harsh landscapes. Due to its unique habitat, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
